Sentence: Little tyke fell asleep just as we were flying over Bristol.
Dry up, Dursley, you great prune.
Mind, I haven't seen you since you was a baby, Harry.
But you're a bit more along than I would have expected.
Afraid I might have sat on it at somepoint, but I imagine it'll taste fine just the same.
Baked it myself, words and all.
It's not every day that your young man turns 11, now is it?
Rubeus Hagrid, Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts.
Of course, you know all about Hogwarts.
No? Blimey, Harry, didn't you ever wonder where your mum and dad learned it all?
And a thumping good one, I'd wager, once you're trained up little.
Well, Just Harry, did you ever make anything happen?
Anything you couldn't explain, when you were angry or scared?
A car crash killed Lily and James Potter?
Oh, and I suppose a great Muggle like yourself's going to stop him, are you?
This boy's had his name down ever since he were born.
He's going to the finest school of witchcraft and wizardry in the world and...
he'll be under the finest headmaster that Hogwarts has ever seen, Albus Dumbledore.
Never insult Albus Dumbledore in front of me.
Oh, um, I'd appreciate it if you didn't tell anyone at Hogwarts about that.
Strickly speaking, I'm not allowed to do magic.
Ooh, We're a bit behind schedule.
Unless you'd rather stay, of course.
They don't mean a penguin, do they?
If you know where to go.
Just helping young Harry here buy his school supplies.
Hello, professor. I didn't see you there.
He will be your Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher at Hogwarts
Yes, well, must be going now.
I'm not sure I'm exactly the right person to tell you that, Harry.
Here's where you'll get your quills and your ink.
And over there, all your bits and bobs for doing your wizardry.
Ain't no safer place, not one.
Clever as they come goblins but not the most friendly of beasts.
Mr. Harry Potter wishes to make a withdrawal.
Oh, and there's something else as well.
It's about You-Know-What in vault you-know-which.
Didn't think your mum and dad will leave you with nothing, now did ya?
Best not to mention this to anyone, Harry.
A wand? Well, you'll want Ollivanders.
Why don't you run along there and wait.
I just got one more thing I gotta do.
First, and understand this Harry because it's very important:
A few years ago there was a one wizard who went as bad as he can go.
It was dark times, Harry. Dark times.
Voldemort started to gather some followers.
Brought them over to the Dark Side.
Anyone that stood up to him ended up dead.
But nobody lived once he decided to kill them.
Yes. That ain't no ordinary cut on your forehead, Harry.
A mark like that only comes from being touched by a curse, and an evil curse at that.
Nope, I reckon he's out there still too tired to carry on.
Something about you stumped him that night.
That's why everybody knows your name.
Sorry, Harry, I'm gonna have to leave you.
Well, he'll be wanting to see me.
Now, uh, your train leaves in 10 minutes.
Stick to it, Harry that's very important.
Come on, now, first years, don't be shy.
Right, then. This way to the boats.
Looks like he's gonna be sick.
Why would Snape put a curse on Harry's broom?
Now, you listen to me, all three of you.
You're meddlin' in things that ought not to be meddled in.
What that dog is guarding is strictly between Professor Dumbledore and Nicholas Flamel.
I should not have said that.
I should not have said that.
Oh, hello. Sorry, don't wish to be rude, but I'm in no fit state to entertain today.
I shouldn't have told you that.
Come on now, hurry up. You'll be late.
Go on. Go on. Come on. Hurry up.
Thought you were leaving without saying good-bye, didja?
Oh, listen, Harry, if that dolt of a cousin of yours, Dudley, gives you any grief, you could always, um, threaten him with a nice pair of ears to go with that tail of his.
I do. But your cousin don't, do he? Eh? Off you go.
What do you think you're doing down here? Come on.
Don't want no one to see you there.
People will think you're up to no good.
I was looking for Flesh-Eating Slug Repellent.
They're ruining all the school cabbages.
You'll be all right now then, Harry?
Right. I'll leave you to it.
This calls for a specialist's equipment.
Nothing to do but wait till it stops, I'm afraid.
Who was Ron trying to curse, anyway?
See, the thing is, Harry, there are some wizards, like the Malfoy family...who think they're better than everyone else because they're pure-blood.
Why, there isn't a wizard alive today that's not half-blood or less.
More to the point, they've yet to think of a spell that our Hermione can't do.
Don't you think on it, Hermione.
Don't you think on it for one minute.
Blimey! Harry's got himself a rogue Bludger.
That's been tampered with, that has.
Professor Dumbledore, sir, it wasn't Harry.
I'd be prepared to swear it in front of the Ministry of Magic.
Let's get you out of there.
Aragog never killed no one. Never.
Mad and hairy? You wouldn't be talking about me, now, would you?
Now, according to Professor Sprout, they've still got a bit of growing to do.
But once their acne's cleared up, we'll chop them up and stew them. and then we'll get those people down at the hospital un-Petrified.
In the meantime, though, you three had best be looking after yourselves.
Nothing. I was expecting... It doesn't matter. Come on in.
I just made a pot of tea.
Oh yeah. I heard about that, all right.
What you had to understand about that is...
Of course. Come in. Come in.
You can't take Professor Dumbledore away.
Take him away and the Muggle-borns won't stand a chance.
You mark my words, there'll be killings next!
If anybody was looking for some stuff then all they'd have to do would be to follow the spiders.
Yep. That would lead them right.
That's all I have to say.
And someone will need to feed Fang while I'm away.
The owl that delivered my release papers got all lost and confused.
And I'd just like to say that if it hadn't been for you, Harry and Ron and Hermione, of course I would still be you-know-where so I'd just like to say thanks.
That's it. Come on, now. Come closer.
Less talking, if you don't mind.
I got a real treat for you today.
A great lesson. So follow me.
And open your books to page 49.
Just stroke the spine, of course.
First thing you wanna know is they're very proud creatures.
You do not want to insult a hippogriff.
It may be the last thing you ever do.
Now, who'd like to come and say hello?
Now you have to let him make the first move.
It's only polite. So step up. Give him a nice bow.
Then you wait and see if he bows back.
If he does, you can go and touch him.
If not... Well, we'll get to that later.
Right. I think you can go and pat him now.
Now let him come to you.
I think he may let you ride him now.
Put you over here, just behind the wing joint.
Don't pull out any of his feathers, because he won't thank you for that.
Well done, Harry, and well done, Buckbeak.
How am I doing me first day?
Calm down. It's just a scratch!
I'm the teacher. I'll do it.
Well, first off, the committee members took turns talking about why we were there.
I got up and did my piece.
Said how Buckbeak was a good hippogriff, always cleaned his feathers.
And then Lucius Malfoy got up.
He said Buckbeak was a deadly and dangerous creature who would kill you as soon as look at you.
And then he asked for the worst, did old Lucius.
Look at him. Loves the smell of the trees when the wind blows through them.
They'd know it was me, and then Dumbledore would get into trouble.
Says he wants to be with me when they...When it happens.
Think I want you seeing something like that? No.
You just drink your tea and be off.
Keep a closer eye on your pet.
Someone sees you outside this time of night, you'll be in trouble.
Have a tea, if you like.
Keep a closer eye on your pet.
You'll find no small glasses in this house, professor.
